1) The detected devices include two Meross Light Strips and a C2C switch. The Meross Light Strips are capable of controlling light levels, color temperature, and color, while the C2C switch can toggle power on and off. These devices are likely located in areas where lighting is adjustable, such as living rooms or bedrooms, and the switch may be positioned in a hallway or near an entrance.

2) The current states of the devices are as follows: the first Meross Light Strip is set to a switch level of 70, while the second is at a switch level of 48. Both light strips are operational, as indicated by their health status. The C2C switch is currently off. Actionable controls include switching the light strips off or adjusting their brightness levels, and the C2C switch can be turned off or on as needed.
